text: Discover 155 breathtaking acres in the remarkable Tober Hollow, nestled on the outskirts of Mammoth Spring, AR. Known for housing one of the world's largest springs, as well as a fish hatchery and state park, Mammoth Spring offers a unique blend of natural beauty and recreational opportunities.This diverse tract of land features various topographies, including the intriguing Tober Cave. Recently explored by a cave hobbyist and Geologist from the Missouri Department of Natural Resources, the cave has been documented with photos and maps, inviting you to continue your adventure in cave exploration.With its pristine environment, this property is ideal for a homestead, hunting, or recreational use. An old cistern, or well, is present on the property, though its condition and type of water source remain unknown. Enjoy abundant wildlife, perfect for both viewing and hunting, while the nearby creek--spring-fed and weather-dependent--adds to the charm, often flowing underground before reemerging downstream.Choose your homesite amidst the forested landscape to build your dream home or cabin. Embrace the allure of the Natural State with no subdivision covenants or restrictions.
